byline.contributor: Brooks Barnes, Michael Cieply, Michael J. de la Merced and Noah Smith contributed reporting.

abstract: Viacom chief executive Philippe P Dauman will replace 92-year-old Sumner M Redstone as executive chairman, but epic tale of power continues over future of $40 billion entertainment firm; Shari Redstone, ostracized from her father until recently, has consistently opposed Dauman's nomination and is continuing efforts to stop Dauman, figure she sees as rival, from permanently heading Viacom.
lead_paragraph: The development comes one day after it was announced that the ailing 92-year-old Mr. Redstone had resigned from his role as executive chairman of CBS.

headline.main: Power Struggle at Viacom as New Leader Is Named
headline.print_headline: Power Struggle Churns Viacom, Even as a New Leader Is Named

snippet: The development comes one day after it was announced that the ailing 92-year-old Mr. Redstone had resigned from his role as executive chairman of CBS.
